fields.name: stage
fields.description:
This query does not allocate streams. Any feeds returned will contain a
zero-value stream.

This query will return all of the feeds on the stage.

This query isn't even required by our clients, but every GraphQL schema is
required to have at least one query.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Roadhog account ID of the owner of the stage (no CAID prefix).

fields.name: username
fields.description: The username of the owner of the stage.

fields.name: broadcastId
fields.description:
For now, clients still need to upload their own images.

A broadcast ID will be created when the stage goes from having no feeds to
having at least one feed.

When a stage goes offline, the broadcastId will be cleared.

This is optional in order to make it easier to deprecate and to ensure that
it is only set when the stage has a valid broadcast ID.

If you don't have a broadcast ID.

fields.name: controllingClient
fields.description:
If the stage is live (or in test mode), then the ControllingClient will be
populated. This indicates that there exists a client that is in "control" of
the stage. While there is a controller, other clients will not be able to
edit the stage unless strictly authorized to do so (according to the client
takeover rules, documented here (TODO)).

fields.name: feeds
fields.description:
Contains only the feeds that the requesting client should be concerned with.
(i.e. The feeds necessary to allow the client to view the stage.)

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

enumValues.name: MOBILE
enumValues.description: iOS and Android

enumValues.name: CAPTURE
enumValues.description: COBS and Lucio (via libcaffeine)

fields.name: gameId
fields.description: Represents content identifiable in Roadhog's game table.

fields.name: role
fields.description:
Reyes may override the role a client specifies in order to maintain a valid
feed / role configuration.

fields.name: restrictions
fields.description:
Currently, only Garrus may set restrictions, which is why they are not
included on the FeedInput type.

Restrictions indicate when content is geofenced. (TODO Rename to
"GeoRestriction"?) If a user tries to view geofenced content, it will
allocate a special stream that shows a message that the content is blocked.

Geofencing is performed based on the client's IP address.

types.name: SourceConnectionQuality
types.description: TODO Follow up on Cog DR discussion.

types.name: Stream
types.description:
A stream is a CDN resource for viewing or broadcasting.

After you get a stream you should _____ (TODO, link to client tech design).

fields.name: addFeed
fields.description:
Add a feed to the stage. Any non-required fields in the input will be filled
with default values if not specified.

Reyes will not allow you to add the feed if another client is controlling the
stage.

TODO Link to the client contention logic documentation in the repo.

Reyes may limit the number of feeds and live hostable feeds each client is allowed to add.

Adding a feed may mutate other feeds, since Reyes always maintains a legal
assignment of roles to the various feeds.

fields.name: setLiveHostingFeed
fields.description:
Sets the live hosting feed to the stage. If a live hosting feed was already on
the stage, this mutation will remove the pre-existing feed.

If you try to set a non-hostable feed, then you will receive an error.

You may also add live hosting feeds using the regular addFeed mutation, but
doing so will give an error if you attempt to add more than a legal number of
live hosting feeds to the stage.

fields.name: updateFeed
fields.description:
Reyes will only modify fields that are explicitly set in the input.

It will give an error of the specified feed does not exist.

fields.name: removeFeed
fields.description:
This mutation will give you an error if you try to remove the last feed on a
live stage.

It will also give an error of the specified feed does not exist.

fields.name: changeStageTitle
fields.description: If a client is controlling the stage, then only that client may change the title.

fields.name: startBroadcast
fields.description:
If multiple clients were in preview mode and had feeds on the stage, starting
a broadcast will remove the feeds no longer in use for the live broadcast.

fields.name: stopBroadcast
fields.description:
keepLiveHostingFeeds, if true, will leave any live hosting feeds on the stage.
Otherwise, all other feeds will be removed.

fields.name: requestViewerStream
fields.description:
Use this when the CDN gives you a 400 type error on the stream to tell Reyes
you need a new viewer stream.

(500's should be retried)

This request will return immediately and trigger an update in the stage
subscription with the new stream.

fields.name: takedownStage
fields.description: This is an admin-only mutation.

types.name: FeedInput
types.description: Required fields that are not set will be set to the specified default values.

inputFields.name: volume
inputFields.description:
Currently, the volume only matters for live hosting content, so that clients
can determine the right balance between the volume of live hosting content
versus the client's content.

Defaults to 1.0; currently only returned on a LiveHostingFeed.

inputFields.name: liveHostable
inputFields.description:
Currently, only Garrus may add live-hostable content, but this is included
for testing. Users without the permission will not be able to make the feed
hostable.

inputFields.name: liveHostingAddress
inputFields.description:
Use this for adding a live hosting feed to the stage.

Must correspond to a valid "address" on a LiveHostableFeed.

inputFields.name: sdpOffer
inputFields.description:
Include the SDP offer when adding a new feed whose content you own and will
be sending into the CDN. The SDP offer is used to allocate a
broadcaster stream for the feed.

inputFields.name: viewerStream
inputFields.description:
If you want to add a live-hosting feed, and you already have a viewer stream
that you want to reuse, include it here.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: stage
fields.description:
Use this subscription to get reactive updates to the stage pushed from Reyes.
Upon connecting, will return immediately with the client's current view of
the stage. As a viewer, this is where stream allocation happens.

args.name: constrainedBaseline
args.description:
Constrained baseline is a required parameter for iOS, Android, and Firefox.

From a wise Caffeine engineer: "Constrained baseline is a H.264 encoding
profile and the minimum supported profile for WebRTC. However not all
implementation of browsers and Android devices supports decoding it."

args.name: viewerStreams
args.description: Specify any viewer streams you'd like to re-use, if applicable.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: CdnError
types.description:
Sometimes life is hard and you can't get a stream, even when you retry (which
Reyes *should* do for you, but doesn't yet).

types.name: OutOfCapacityError
types.description:
This is an error specifically for when we have no more capacity. Clients should
not retry when they get this.

types.name: BroadcasterStream
types.description: For sending data into the CDN.

fields.name: ownerId
fields.description:
ownerId is the account ID of the owner of the stage that is providing the
underlying live-hostable content.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ViewerStream
types.description: For viewing data from the CDN.

types.name: ClientContentionError
types.description:
Reyes will now enforce rules around when and how clients are able to take over
the stage. (See documentation here (TODO)).

For example, if you try to start a broadcaston Lucio and Reyes does not allow
it, the user will receive a message via this Error type.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service’s schema, such as deprecated fields on a type or deprecated enum values.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.
